title: Remove entire bottom/footer area from website

requirements.text: Remove the entire bottom-of-website footer area from the app layout so no footer content (e.g., copyright text, external links/icons, borders, or footer padding) appears on any page.

quotes: Can you remove everything in the bottom of website

acceptanceCriteria: The <footer> section currently rendered in frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout.tsx is removed (or not rendered) so no footer content appears at the bottom of any route.
After the change, there is no visible bottom border/top border line, footer spacing, or reserved footer area beneath the main content; pages end cleanly at the bottom of their content.
No backend changes are required and no authenticated/unauthenticated navigation behavior is altered.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep the existing single-actor Motoko backend architecture unchanged.
nonGoals: Do not redesign the header/navigation or change routing.
Do not change authentication, complaint workflows, or any backend APIs/state.
